text: Today in # Herstory: In 1924 Inge Sørensen born. She was a swimmer from Denmark, and the youngest known female Olympic Games medalist in an individual event. She won the bronze medal in the 200 m breaststroke at the 1936 Summer Olympics at the age of 12 years and 24 days. pic.twitter.com/rvaCb2AXZt

Nazi filmmaker Leni Riefenstahl shot the footage of the 1936 Summer Olympics in Berlin for her propaganda movie Olympia. Much of Riefenstahl's revolutionary cinematic techniques would go on to be used in future Olympic games. pic.twitter.com/mIwdnXFzxL
The 1936 Summer Olympics began 81 years ago today in Berlin. They were the first televised Olympic games. # Olympics # TVHistory
